Cell.Data: A conformance statement about how an application or implementation supports FHIR or the set of requirements for a desired implementation
Logical id to reference this statement
The identifier that is used to identify this conformance statement when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance (should be globally unique OID, UUID, or URI)
Logical id for this version of the statement

The identifier that is used to identify this version of the conformance statement when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the profile author manually and the value should be a timestamp
There may be multiple resource versions of the conformance statement that have this same identifier
Informal name for this conformance statement
A free text natural language name identifying the conformance statement
Not expected to be globally unique
Contacts for Organization relevant to this conformance statement. May be website, email, phone numbers, etc.
Human description of the conformance statement

A free text natural language description of the conformance statement and its use. Typically, this is used when the profile describes a desired rather than an actual solution, for example as a formal expression of requirements as part of an RFP

This field can be used for things such as why the confomrance statement was written, comments about its context etc. This does not need to be populated when the description is adequately implied by the software or implementation details
The status of this conformance statement
This is not intended for use with actual conformance statements, but where conformance statements are used to describe possible or desired systems
If for testing purposes, not real usage
This conformance statement was authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing), and is not intended to be used for genuine usage
Allows filtering of conformance statements that are appropriate for use vs. not
Date that the conformance statement is published
Software that is covered by this conformance statement
Describes the software that is covered by this conformance statement. Used when the profile describes the capabilities of a particular software version, independent of an installation.
If possible, version should be specified, as statements are likely to be different for different versions of software
Date this version of the software released
If this describes a specific instance
Used when the statement describes the capabilities of a specific implementation instance - i.e. a particular installation, rather than the capabilities of a software program
Information about the specific installation that this conformance statement relates to
The base URL for the implementation. This forms the base for REST interfaces as well as the mailbox and document interfaces.
The version of the FHIR specification on which this conformance statement is based
True if application accepts unknown elements
Whether the application accepts unknown non-"must understand" elements as part of a resource. This does not include extensions, but genuine new additions to a resource
The formats supported by this implementation
"xml" or "json" are allowed, which describe the simple encodings described in the specification (and imply appropriate bundle support). Otherwise, mime types are legal here
If the endpoint is a RESTful one
Defines the restful capabilities of the solution, if any
Multiple repetitions allow definition of both client and server behaviors or possibly behaviors under different configuration settings (for software or requirements statements)
Identifies whether this portion of the statement is describing ability to initiate or receive restful operations
Provides documentation about the system's restful capabilities that apply across all applications, such as security
Ballot Question: Do we need something more formal for security capabilities?
Server adds CORS headers when responding to reuqests - this enables javascript applications to yuse the server
The easiest CORS headers to add are Access-Control-Allow-Origin: * & Access-Control-Request-Method: GET, POST, PUT, DELETE
What type of security services are supported/required
What type of security services are supported/required
General description of how security works
General description of how security works
Resource served on the REST interface
Identifies the restful capabilities of the solution for a specific resource type
Max of one repetition per resource type
If a system wide history list is supported
Identifies the resource exposed via the restful interface
Identifies the profile that describes the solution's support for the resource, including any constraints on cardinality, bindings, lengths or other limitations
This profile applies to all the resources of this type - i.e. it is the superset of what is supported
Ballot: Does a system need to be able to enumerate profiles that it does support?
Identifies a restful operation supported by the solution

Provides guidance specific to the implementation of this operation, such as 'delete is a logical delete' or 'updates are only allowed with version id' or 'creates permitted from pre-authorized certificates only'
REST allows a degree of variability in the implementation of RESTful solutions that is useful for exchange partners to be aware of.
Whether vRead can return past versions
A flag for whether the server is able to return past versions as part of the vRead operation
It is useful to support the vRead operation for current operations, even if past versions aren't available
If this list is empty, the server does not support includes
Defines additional search parameters for implementations to support and/or make use of
Corresponds to the name of the standard or custom search parameter
Parameter names cannot overlap with standard parameter names, and standard parameters cannot be redefined
A formal reference to where this parameter was first defined, so that a client can be confident of the meaning of the search parameter

This SHOULD be populated for all search parameters not defined as custom search extensions. The uri for a search parameter defined in the specification itself is http://hl7.org/fhir/[resource]/search#[name]
The type of value a search parameter refers to, and how the content is interpreted
Contents and meaning of search parameter
For standard parameters, provides additional information on how the parameter is used in this solution. For custom parameters, provides a description of what the parameter does
XPath that extracts the parameter set
An XPath expression that extracts the set of elements that contain values that a search parameter matches

Note that the elements are sometimes complex elements where logic is required to determine quite how to handle them. E.g. CodeableConcepts may contain text and/or multiple codings, where the codings themselves contain a code and a system
Types of resource (if a resource reference)
Definition of a named query and its parameters and their meaning
The name of this query, which is used in the _query parameter when the query is used
Description of the query - the functionality it offers, and considerations about how it functions and to use it
Describes the messaging capabilities of the solution
Multiple repetitions allow the documentation of multiple endpoints per solution
The address to which messages and/or replies are to be sent.
Can be just an identifier for solutions that do not use network addresses for routing.
The length if the receiver's reliable messaging cache length (if a receiver) or how long the cache length on the receiver should be (if a sender)

Provides documentation about the system's messaging capabilities for this endpoint not otherwise documented by the conformance statement. For example, process for becoming an authorized messaging exchange partner.
If this value is missing then the application does not implement (receiver) or depend on (sender) reliable messaging
Describes the solution's support for an event at this end point.
The same event may be listed up to two times - once as sender and once as receiver.
Need to add follow-ups and need to do more to flesh out messaging dynamic model
May need profile id as well if profiles can define message events
The mode of this event declaration - whether application is sender or receiver
Identifies the messaging transport protocol(s) supported by this endpoint
Loosen this to "extensible" once tooling supports that.
Identifies the resource associated with the event. This is the resource that defines the event.
This SHALL be provided if the event type supports multiple different resource types
Information about the request for this event
Information about the response for this event
Guidance on how this event is handled, such as internal system trigger points, business rules, etc.
The mode of this event declaration - whether application is sender or receiver
Describes how the application supports or uses the specified document profile. For example, when are documents created, what action is taken with consumed documents, etc.
Constraint on a resource used in the document
Constraint on a resource used in the document
The first resource is the document resource
A Conformance statement SHALL have at least one of rest, messaging or document
SHALL have at least one of description, software, or implementation
Messaging end point is required (and is only permitted) when statement is for an implementation
part of a the name of a software application
name of a resource mentioned in a conformance statement
event code in a conformance statement
a profile id invoked in a conformance statement
The mode of a RESTful conformance statement
Types of security services used with FHIR
The mode of a message conformance statement
The protocol used for message transport
Whether the application produces or consumes documents
The status of this conformance statement
Data types allowed to be used for search parameters
The application acts as a server for this resource
The application acts as a client for this resource
Read the current state of the resource
Read the state of a specific version of the resource
Update an existing resource by its id (or create it if it is new)
Retrieve the update history for a resource instance
Check that the content would be acceptable as an update
Get a list of updates to resources of this type
Create a new resource with a server assigned id
Supports search operations using the parameters described in the profile
Get a list of updates to all resources on the system
The application sends requests and receives responses
The application receives requests and sends responses
The application sends or receives messages using HTTP POST (may be over http or https)
The application sends or receives messages using File Transfer Protocol
The application sends or receivers messages using HL7's Minimal Lower Level Protocol
The application produces documents of the specified type
The application consumes documents of the specified type
Basic authentication defined in HTTP specification
This conformance statement is still under development
This conformance statement is ready for use in production systems
This conformance statement has been withdrawn or superceded and should no longer be used
Search parameter SHALL be a simple whole number

Search parameter is a simple string, like a name part. Search is case-insensitive and accent-insensitive. May match just the start of a string. String parameters may contain spaces and are delineated by double quotes, e.g. "van Zanten".

Search parameter is on a long string. Used for text filter type search: it functions on searches within a body of text and may contain spaces to separate words. May match even if the separate words are found out of order. Text parameters are delineated by double quotes.
Search parameter is on a date (and should support :before and :after modifiers). The date format is the standard XML format, though other formats may be supported

Search parameter on a coded element or identifier. May be used to search through the text, displayname, code and code/codesystem (for codes) and label, system and key (for identifier). Its value is either a string or a pair of namespace and value, separated by a "/", depending on the modifier used

A pair of resource type and resource id, separated by "/". Matches when the resource reference resolves to a resource of the given type and id. The resource type may be omitted to search all types if used with the modifier :any
A composite search parameter that combines other search parameters together
